au.edu.uts.eng.remotelabs.rigclient.rig
Interface IRigExerciser

All Known Subinterfaces:
IRig
All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractControlledRig, AbstractRig, ConfiguredControlledRig, ConfiguredRig, TestConfiguredControlledRig
public interface IRigExerciser

Interface for rig exerciser / monitoring operations. The exerciser is a rig watch-dog to ensure the rig is within operational tolerance. Exercisers are built chaining together multiple exerciser tests and should test the following rig attributes:

  • Existence (network, device nodes) - can the device be contacted.
  • Environment (power, air pressure) - does the current environment support the operating needs of the rig.
  • Hardware (pistons, actuators, solenoids, motors) - can be the hardware be commanded to be perform its desired actions.
  • Sensor (LVDS, magnetostrictive, temperature, time) - does a movement of the hardware generate the desired measurable results within a tolerance of the expected results.
The setInterval method provides an indication of how often the test should run and the test implementor has discretion to either honour or ignore the test interval. It is suggested, tests which provide a noticeable affect or yield the rig should run at the test interval period, tests which do not, should run often to detect errors and problems at the earliest possible time.

True if the rig exerciser / monitor detects the experiment is within operation tolerance.

Returns:
true if rig monitor is good, false otherwise

getMonitorReason

java.lang.String getMonitorReason()
Gets the reason the rig exerciser / monitor is bad. If the rig exerciser is good null is returned.

Returns:

getMaintenanceReason

java.lang.String getMaintenanceReason()
Gets the reason provided for the rig to be in maintenance mode. If the rig is not in maintenance mode or not reason was provided, null is returned.

Returns:
in maintenance reason

setInterval

boolean setInterval(int interval)
Sets the rig test interval. The interval value is how often the tests should be run in minutes.

Parameters:
interval - test interval in minutes
Returns:
true if operation successful, false otherwise

setMaintenance

boolean setMaintenance(boolean offline,
                       java.lang.String reason,
                       boolean runTests)
Sets the maintenance state of the rig. If the passed offline flag is true, the rig is put into maintenance, otherwise the rig is taken out of maintenance mode and the rig maintenance reason is cleared if it set.

If the rig is to be put into maintenance, the stopTests flag specifies if the exerciser tests should be run in maintenance mode. If the rig is being taken out of maintenance mode, the stopTests flag is ignored (if the rig is operational, the exerciser should always run).

Parameters:
offline - true if the rig is put into maintenance mode
reason - a reason why the rig is being put in maintenance mode
runTests - true if rig exerciser tests should be run in maintenance mode
Returns:
true if operation successful, false otherwise
